Key Arguments: The legislation threatens freedom of speech, which is a fundamental value of Australia.
Freedom of speech is essential for discovering truth and allowing for the testing and questioning of ideas.
The government should not be the arbiter of truth, as this could halt essential dialogue and debate.
The internet serves as a modern 'town square' for the exchange of ideas, both true and false, and this should not be restricted by the government.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech is the bedrock of a free and fair society.
The proposed bill will effectively halt this essential dialogue.
Setting up the government as the arbiter of truth is not the answer.
